description: Core build philosophy memories that govern all Maturion development

entries.title: One-Time Build Correctness Principle
entries.summary: Every build must be correct on the first attempt. No iterative debugging, no trial-and-error. Architecture, requirements, and QA must be complete before building begins.
entries.author: foreman

details.rationale: Ensures high quality, reduces waste, prevents rework, maintains architectural integrity
constraints: Architecture must be 100% complete before build starts
All requirements must be unambiguous and validated
QA coverage must be defined before implementation
No module may begin build without passing readiness checks

entries.title: Zero Regression Guarantee
entries.summary: No change may break existing functionality. All working code, tests, and behavior must remain intact. Extensions are allowed; breakage is forbidden.
entries.author: foreman

details.rationale: Protects platform stability, ensures customer trust, maintains production reliability
constraints: All existing tests must continue to pass
No removal of working features without explicit approval
All changes must include regression test coverage
enforcement_mechanisms: Foreman approval required for breaking changes

entries.title: Full Architectural Alignment
entries.summary: Every module, component, and integration must align with the master architecture. No deviation, no drift, no exceptions. Architecture is law.
entries.author: foreman

details.rationale: Ensures system coherence, enables safe evolution, prevents fragmentation, maintains integration integrity
constraints: All builds reference specific architecture sections
Module boundaries must not be violated

entries.title: Zero Loss of Context
entries.summary: All architectural decisions, rationales, and governance details must be preserved. Never discard, oversimplify, or lose important context. Memory is permanent.
entries.author: foreman

details.rationale: Prevents knowledge loss, enables informed decisions, supports continuity across model upgrades and chat resets
preservation_requirements: All architectural decisions documented with rationale
All governance changes tracked in change records
All build outcomes captured in memory

entries.title: Zero Ambiguity Principle
entries.summary: All governance rules, requirements, and specifications must be explicit and machine-checkable. Vague language that cannot be enforced is forbidden.
entries.author: foreman

details.rationale: Enables automated enforcement, prevents misinterpretation, ensures consistency, supports AI-driven governance
requirements: All acceptance criteria must be measurable
